node.title: Rittenhouse Judge Says He Allowed Defendant to Pick Jurors to Protect 'Optics'
node.description: Judge Bruce Schroeder said ever since he tried a case with "bad optics" around picking which jurors would deliberate, he has had the "almost universal policy."

node.title: 'It hurts, but it's a good thing': Human remains discovered in Pike River mine
node.description: A turbulent mix of emotions are being felt as - just two days shy of the 11th anniversary of the Pike River mine disaster- human remains have been discovered.

node.title: ‘The Antelope Party’ Review: Friendship Is Magic, With Exceptions
node.description: Paranoia takes root among five friends who fear their “My Little Pony” role playing game is being targeted in this new play at the Wild Project.

node.title: They Love Crypto. They’re Trying to Buy the Constitution.
node.description: How a “financial flash mob” is trying to raise $20 million for a rare copy of the U.S. Constitution.

node.title: A new witness supports the original alibi of one of the wrongfully convicted men.
node.description: The witness is an 80-year-old Brooklyn resident who answered the telephone at the Nation of Islam Mosque in Harlem the day Malcolm X was killed.

node.title: A timeline of major events in the case since Malcolm X’s death.
node.description: Uncertainties about who really killed Malcolm X have plagued the case since 1965.

node.title: ICC to study Afghanistan situation
node.description: The International Cricket Council has set up a working group to determine the future of the game in Afghanistan under the Taliban government.

node.title: Greece to Put Aid Workers Who Helped Migrants on Trial on Espionage Charges
node.description: The country’s conservative government is toughening its stance on migration and on groups working with migrants, aligning itself with a hardening climate across Europe.

node.title: Popular European Destinations That Unvaccinated People Can and Can't Travel To
node.description: Several European countries have placed travel restrictions on unvaccinated travelers from the United States.

node.title: Why Smallpox Is so Dangerous As Vials Found in Pennsylvania
node.description: The FBI and CDC are investigating after 15 vials labeled "smallpox" were discovered at a lab outside Philadelphia.

node.title: Radioactive Water From Fukushima Plant Would Have Small Environmental Impact: Operator
node.description: Japan planned to release treated radioactive water in the spring of 2023 after data simulation said there's little environmental impact. Experts aren't so sure.

node.title: Bear Cub Plays in Snow for the First Time in Adorable Video
node.description: After being found in a yard of a home in May, Aina romped around with Sulo "The bearman" Karjalainen.

node.title: Watch NHL Player Kevin Hayes Honor Late Brother Jimmy After Scoring First Goal of Season
node.description: After scoring the goal, Hayes said that he planned to give the puck to his brother's son, Beau.

node.title: Judge in Ahmaud Arbery Trial Again Denies Defense Mistrial, Ban of High-Profile Visitors
node.description: Defense attorneys argued that the presence of high-profile visitors, such as civil rights leaders, could alter the jury's verdict.

node.title: Monarch Butterflies Return to California in Large Numbers After Last Year's Historic Low
node.description: Pacific Grove in California is one of the many areas the butterflies are expected to land during the winter.

node.title: Justus Rosenberg, Beloved Professor With a Heroic Past, Dies at 100
node.description: As a teenager, he helped provide safe passage to artists and intellectuals out of Vichy France. He went on to teach literature at Bard College for six decades.

node.title: Philip Margo of the Tokens, Who Sang of a Snoozing Lion, Dies at 79
node.description: His baritone contributed to the 1961 hit “The Lion Sleeps Tonight,” which became one of the most recognizable American pop songs ever.

node.title: The Secret to Great Online Communities
node.description: Our online experiences are shaped by the people who run our favorite Facebook group or Reddit forum.

node.title: The prosecution’s case against Elizabeth Holmes, the Theranos founder.
node.description: Jurors are being asked to decide whether Ms. Holmes misled investors by withholding crucial information or whether investors simply failed to do their due diligence.

node.title: Oklahoma Governor and Pentagon Standoff Over Vaccines Intensifies
node.description: The state says its National Guard members don’t need to get vaccinated. Pentagon officials say a failure to follow “valid medical readiness requirements” could “jeopardize” the status of troops.

node.title: Sudanese forces kill 10 protesting the country’s recent coup, medics report.
node.description: The violence is shadowing Secretary of State Antony Blinken’s visit to Africa.

node.title: Steve Bannon's Lawyer Decries 'Vindictive' Prosecution by Jan 6. Committee
node.description: David Schoen has taken aim at the congressional committee examining the events that led up to the U.S. Capitol riots.

node.title: Lobster Harvesting Ban Reinstated Off Maine Coast in Effort to Protect Rare Whales
node.description: A U.S. appeals court ruled that the government's role is "assuring the right whales are protected from a critical risk of death."

node.title: In the suburbs of Melbourne, Logan felt a void in his life. He filled it with fire
node.description: Leaving the beaches of Samoa for the suburbs of Melbourne created a void in Logan’s life, one that could only be filled by returning to his roots.

node.title: With a federal election looming, the Great Resignation presents politicians with big opportunities
node.description: For employers trying to keep and attract the best staff, COVID-inspired upheaval in Australia's job market presents enormous challenges. For politicians facing a looming election, it presents opportunities, writes David Speers.

node.title: The Legacy of Mattress Cash Fires
node.description: Before we get to the metaverse, we need to talk about the past decade of tech ideas.

node.title: Germany Weighs 5 Years in Prison for Forging COVID Test Results, Vaccine Documents
node.description: Germany is also mulling stricter rules for workplaces and giving employees the opportunity to work remotely when possible to curb infection rates.

node.title: Inmate Whose 1963 Case Later Led to Freedom for Teen Offenders Finally Granted Parole
node.description: Henry Montgomery, 75, will be a free man after spending his entire adult life in the Louisiana State Penitentiary for killing a sheriff's deputy at age 17.

node.title: TSA head expects busy but "smooth" holiday travel season
node.description: Experts fear that a possible staff shortage could lead to long security lines at U.S. airports, which are expected to see up to 80% more travelers compared with last year.

node.title: Review: In ‘Anna,’ the End of Adults, but Not the World

node.title: School Nurses Feel Like ‘The Enemy’

node.title: Jan. 6 Defendant Known as QAnon Shaman Sentenced to 41 Months

node.title: 'Beauty Consultant' Accused of Killing Woman With Illegal Silicone Butt Injections
node.description: Lisa Fernandez, 47, has been charged with second degree felony manslaughter following the death of Marja McClendon.

node.title: 3 States Saw Large Increase in Overdose Deaths, Which Topped 100K in U.S. Over Last Year
node.description: Experts say that the pandemic and the increase of fentanyl mixed by drug dealers into other drugs are primary factors in the increase.

node.title: Fatal Surfside Condo Collapse Occurred Due to Construction of High-Rise Next Door: Lawsuit
node.description: A new lawsuit filed for the victims and family members of Champlain Towers South in Miami said, "the collapse was entirely preventable."

node.title: Drug crisis, corruption and COVID-19 on voters' minds as Tonga heads to the polls
node.description: While climate change and COVID-19 have dominated the news cycle, Tonga's battle with corruption and drug use are also front of mind for voters as they head to the polls.

node.title: As the NT's COVID outbreak grows, so are questions about why this at-risk community isn't in lockdown
node.description: Pressure is growing on the NT government to declare a lockdown in Borroloola, a large remote community with strong links to Robinson River where six Aboriginal people have so far tested positive to COVID amid a Territory cluster.

node.title: The same places keep appearing in most-disadvantaged lists. COVID means it could be getting worse
node.description: The most comprehensive report into disadvantage in Australia reveals disadvantage is not only entrenched in some communities, it also impacts a wide range of factors.

node.title: Managers more likely to think pay is fair - study
node.description: Employees are also more doubtful than managers about their organisation's pay transparency, the study found.

node.title: All Whites finish great year

node.title: America's Cup continues to cut costs
node.description: The rules for the next America's Cup have been released but the wait continues for a venue.

node.title: Covid-19 wrap: Auckland on path to reopening, vaccine pass launched
node.description: Schools have reopened for younger students, the Auckland boundary is set to reopen mid-December for a month, and a Covid-19 vaccine pass has come into play.

node.title: Bishops approve Communion guidelines after debate on Biden's eligibility
node.description: Catholic bishops from across the U.S. voted on a document outlining the meaning of the sacrament of Communion and who should receive it.
